pages.text: During your travels, you may have come across various villages and their studious inhabitants. $(br2)Some of them, in fact, qualify as engineers! Their professions and trade goods are outlined here.

The $(l)Structural Engineer$() deals in construction materials such as treated wood, scaffolding, and concrete. If you get friendly enough with them, they might even sell you a treasure map to a nearby $(l:patchouli:overview/mineral_deposits)Mineral Vein$()... $(br)Their workstation is an $(#007500)Engineer's Crafting Table$().

The $(l)Machinist$() is an expert in metals, mechanics and tools. They sell their surplus hammers, toolboxes and drill heads. Particularly experienced machinists even know how to draw blueprints for $(l:patchouli:overview/graphite)graphite electrodes$(). $(br)Their workstation is an $(#007500)Anvil$().

The $(l)Electrician$() offers wirecutters, coils of wire and pieces of a faraday suit. Some less reputable villagers may also have a stash of experimental weapon upgrades... $(br)Their workstation is an $(#007500)Engineer's Circuit Table$().

The $(l)Gunsmith$() deals with the recently popular firearms. Apart from selling various kinds of ammunition, they also manufacture some rare pieces for the $(l:patchouli:tools/revolver)Revolver$() that influence its performance. $(br)Their workstation is an $(#007500)Engineer's Workbench$().

The $(l)Outfitter$() may not seem like a traditional engineer, although their field of work is no less precise! Whereas others manufacture components and assemble large structures, they instead design unique colour patterns known as $(l:patchouli:overview/shaders)Shaders$(). $(br)They sell shader grab bags, enabling you to randomly acquire pieces of their craft. Their workstation is a $(#007500)Shader Banner$(), which is created by using a shader on a normal, placed banner.
